result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Finn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on Ct. 1.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 3.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   No contact direct or indirect with victim or her family without prior approval of victim or probation agent. Not to possess or use any firearms or weapons.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - to be used at the Courts discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted. If probation is revoked, defendant would be entitled to 22 days sentence credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Richard J Finn in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Defendant Richard J Finn in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Richard J Finn in court with attorney David R. Clowers.  Defendant Richard J Finn in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Clowers has received an offer from the State which may resolve the matter. Atty Clowers requests a status later this week. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Richard J Finn in court, in custody, with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Atty Maciolek indicates defendant qualifies for PD representation, unsure if he or another atty will be representing defendant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Defense waives time limits for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with J.C., C.C. or their residence.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess weapons of any kind.

Defendant Richard J Finn appears by video conference.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
